oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Optimising the use of hen runs by structures and management
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zeltner, Esther
Hirt, Helen
Hauser, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poultry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of the main problems in free range husbandry of laying hens is the uneven use of the hen run. This leads to an overuse of pasture near the hen house. In a series of behavioural experiments we tried to determine management and structuring factors which may result in more hens in the run and a more even distribution of the animals.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zeltner, Esther; Hirt, Helen and Hauser, J. (2005) Optimising the use of hen runs by structures and management. Poster at: 7th European Symposium on Poultry Welfare, Lublin, Polen, 15-19 June 2005. [Unpublished]
